events.name: Meet WITHIN COO Colin Decker - A Fireside Chat & Dinner
events.description: WITHIN needs no introduction in VR circles. Founded by award-winning filmmaker Chris Milk and renowned technologist Aaron Koblin, WITHIN is on a mission to explore and expand the potential of immersive storytelling. The company has created immersive stories in partnership with organisations like Apple, The New York Times, National Geographic and Vice Media, showcasing them on its content distribution app, while winning numerous industry awards along the way. Join us for A Fireside Chat & Dinner with Chief Operating Officer Colin Decker who joined WITHIN earlier this year to help shape the next phase of the company’s growth. Most recently he served as COO for the anime streaming service Crunchyroll, where he helped to grow the service’s audience from 750,000 to over one million paying subscribers. Colin is a veteran of the media industry. He previously worked as SVP and GM of Discovery Digital Networks. He was also the lead advisor to both Richard Branson’s Virgin Investments Media & Telecom group, as well as the leading data insights service Tubular Labs. This meetup is in partnership with IMDA. AGENDA:6.30pm Catered Dinner by IMDA7.30pm Fireside Chat with Colin Decker, hosted by Ashima Thomas, Chair AsiaVR Association8.15pm Q & A with audience8.30pm Networking, meet & greet and showcase with Colin. SHOWCASE: Please bring along any of the work/technology you’d like to show Colin. We’ll set aside an area for showcasing. =End=
events.location: PIXEL Studios (Level 2), 10, central green exchange, Singapore
events.group_name: AsiaVR Association - Singapore Virtual Reality Meetup Group

events.name: Zero to Hero using Microsoft Bot Framework
events.description: Presented by Sohel Shekha, Microsoft MVP In this meet up we will use Microsoft Bot Framework to create, build, test and deploy intelligent bots on websites, apps or social media (Skype, Slack, Facebook Messenger, etc). You will learn how Azure Bot Service helps speed up development by providing an integrated environment that’s purpose-built for bot development with the Microsoft Bot Framework connectors and BotBuilder SDKs. Level: 200 (basic programming knowledge needed) Schedule: 18:30 - 19:00 doors open, networking19:00 - 20:30 main presentation20:30 - 21:00 Q&A, networking
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, Level 22, Room CF15, One Marina Boulevard

events.name: Talk Data To Me: Learning Resources and Books for Data Analysts and Scientists
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/talk-data-me-learning-resources-and-books-data-analysts-and-scientists Talk Data To Me: Learning Resources and Books for Data Analysts and Scientists Organised by General Assembly. Partnered with SGInnovate At this event, we host thought-leaders from the data community to discuss the possibilities that data brings to life. They’ll cover the best resources to start with data science and how to stay up to date.Why It Matters:According to a Forbes article, “2017 will be the year big data goes mainstream … whether gathering data on the front end or making big decisions in the C-Suite, every single person in your organization must buy into the value [data] analytics brings”. Data is everywhere, and it affects not only how we run our businesses, but how we live as individuals. Understanding the ways you can leverage data in your personal and professional life can help you find key insights, make smarter decisions, and elevate your career. Agenda:6:30pm - 7:00pm: Check-in & Networking7:00pm - 7:45pm: Panel/Lighting Talks7:45pm - 8:30pm: Q&A and Networking

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include: • DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis, • Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and • Planning sessions for wider community events. Important to note • Unlike a normal meetup, if you sign up but don't show, you will be depriving our non-profit partners of other volunteers who can be there to help them. Please be considerate when you sign up, thank you. • It would be great if you bring your own water bottle along with your laptop and power cable too. [Please watch this space for updates] Project overview• WaterPoint Data Exchange (https://www.waterpointdata.org/) -The Water Point Data Exchange (WPDx) is the global platform for sharing water point data. In this Project Accelerator, we would discuss with WPDx representatives on how using WPDx data, better decisions can be made to ensure water service delivery is sustained in rural areas around the world. With almost 400,000 records, WPDx is currently the largest public repository of water point data. 6.45 - 7.00 p.m.: Registration7.00 - 7.30 p.m.: Networking7.30 - 9.30 p.m.: Project Overview and Discussion
events.location: Tableau Singapore, South Beach Tower Level 10, 38 Beach Road

events.name: Singapore Women & Non Binary Tech Community Dinner ❤️
events.description:
Visiting Singapore for an Azure event, why not enjoy a lovely evening with local women and non binary tech friends?
Hosted by Nina & Allison on the Microsoft Cloud Developer Advocacy team, but no agenda. Meet, talk, share, and of course eat great food in a beautiful setting : )
Questions: alkrug@microsoft.com 
We kindly ask that attendees identify as female or non binary. Thank you.
events.location: Smoke & Mirrors, #06-01 National Gallery Singapore 1 St. Andrew's Road, Singapore 178957

events.name: Make Music with GarageBand iOS Workshop
events.description:
Are you a music lover? Someone who wanted to create your own beat but having limited knowledge on music? Never played an instrument before but having a strong passion and interest towards music and hope someday you can express yourself with at-least one musical instrument? Well this workshop is for you!



GarageBand can be one of the solutions for you to kick start your music dream! What if we told you that without any music background you can still perform and create your own tune like you have done it for years? What if we told you that we can show you the way on how you can start creating your very own tune from stretch without any fancy or expensive equipments but with only an iPhone/iPad anytime and anywhere you go?

Technology nowadays have changed the way how we see and do things, it gives us the flexibility to create and express ourselves almost without boundaries in many different ways. In this case, GarageBand.

GarageBand have literally changed the way how musicians around the world compose and express themselves through music. Inspiration always comes without you getting ready or prepared, but GarageBand will always be ready whenever you are. With it now you can perform and compose your own music anytime anywhere you prefer or feel like doing it. 

Want to learn how you can fully utilize your iOS devices and start making some of your own beats with GarageBand? Come and join us at Switch Makers and learn with a group of people who might have shared the same interest and idea with you! 
P/S: You are recommded to download the GarageBand app before attending if you have an iOS device, it's FREE!
events.location: Switch AEON Mall Bandar Dato’ Onn, Lot F29, First Floor, Aeon Mall Kempas, No. 3, Jalan Dato’Onn, Bandar Dato’Onn,, Johor Bahru 81100
